title: Elementary Science Teacher Professional Development Program Through Blended Learning: Enhancing Inquiry Skills Based on Experiments and Observations

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and substantial professional experience: competency in scientific experimental design, variable control methods, and foundational data analysis
context.additional_context: For managers in corporate science education institutions: Implementing sustainable PD models using solar energy and open educational resources in BYOD environments. Focuses on inquiry lesson design centered on experimental observation and strengthening scientific analysis competencies via digital tools

learning_goals: Develop at least three activity-based instructional materials for blended learning designs reflecting the scientific inquiry process (including hypothesis formulation, variable control, and data analysis).
Write a collaborative learning strategy-based science lesson design and implementation plan, including experimental observation records and evidence-based conclusion activities.
Establish a digital science content production and sharing system using open-source tools, utilizing virtual experiment simulations and measurement data visualization tools.

Within three weeks, learners draft a corporate local expert mentoring guideline meeting the following criteria: 1) specify mentoring cycles (weekly/monthly), 2) include at least three performance evaluation indicators (experimental design ability, data analysis accuracy, scientific communication skills), 3) present at least two field application cases (solar energy experiments, open educational resource-based classes), and 4) incorporate feedback from department heads and three mentors.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
